intro: Grewia chlorophila, commonly known as the white-flowered grewia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. The plant has simple, elliptical leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that turns red when mature. Grewia chlorophila is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
